docsTags.name: virtualProp
docsTags.text: {"ios" | "md"} mode - The mode determines which platform styles to use.

docsTags.name: slot
docsTags.text: - The label text to associate with the checkbox. Use the "labelPlacement" property to control where the label is placed relative to the checkbox.

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: container - The container for the checkbox mark.

docsTags.name: part
docsTags.text: mark - The checkmark used to indicate the checked state.

props.name: alignment
props.docs:
How to control the alignment of the checkbox and label on the cross axis.
`"start"`: The label and control will appear on the left of the cross axis in LTR, and on the right side in RTL.
`"center"`: The label and control will appear at the center of the cross axis in both LTR and RTL.

props.name: color
props.docs:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the checkbox.

props.name: indeterminate
props.docs: If `true`, the checkbox will visually appear as indeterminate.

props.name: justify
props.docs:
How to pack the label and checkbox within a line.
`"start"`: The label and checkbox will appear on the left in LTR and
on the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label and checkbox will appear on the right in LTR and
on the left in RTL.
`"space-between"`: The label and checkbox will appear on opposite
ends of the line with space between the two elements.

props.name: labelPlacement
props.docs:
Where to place the label relative to the checkbox.
`"start"`: The label will appear to the left of the checkbox in LTR and to the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label will appear to the right of the checkbox in LTR and to the left in RTL.
`"fixed"`: The label has the same behavior as `"start"` except it also has a fixed width. Long text will be truncated with ellipses ("...").
`"stacked"`: The label will appear above the checkbox regardless of the direction. The alignment of the label can be controlled with the `alignment` property.

props.name: legacy
props.docs:
Set the `legacy` property to `true` to forcibly use the legacy form control markup.
Ionic will only opt checkboxes in to the modern form markup when they are
using either the `aria-label` attribute or have text in the default slot. As a result,
the `legacy` property should only be used as an escape hatch when you want to
avoid this automatic opt-in behavior.

Note that this property will be removed in an upcoming major release
of Ionic, and all form components will be opted-in to using the modern form markup.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: value
props.docs:
The value of the checkbox does not mean if it's checked or not, use the `checked`
property for that.

The value of a checkbox is analogous to the value of an `<input type="checkbox">`,
it's only used when the checkbox participates in a native `<form>`.

events.docs: Emitted when the checkbox loses focus.

Emitted when the checked property has changed
as a result of a user action such as a click.
This event will not emit when programmatically
setting the checked property.
Emitted when the checkbox has focus.

styles.name: --border-color
styles.docs: Border color of the checkbox icon

styles.name: --border-color-checked
styles.docs: Border color of the checkbox icon when checked

styles.name: --border-radius
styles.docs: Border radius of the checkbox icon

styles.name: --border-style
styles.docs: Border style of the checkbox icon

styles.name: --border-width
styles.docs: Border width of the checkbox icon

styles.name: --checkbox-background-checked
styles.docs: Background of the checkbox icon when checked

styles.name: --checkmark-color
styles.docs: Color of the checkbox checkmark when checked

styles.name: --checkmark-width
styles.docs: Stroke width of the checkbox checkmark

slots.docs: The label text to associate with the checkbox. Use the "labelPlacement" property to control where the label is placed relative to the checkbox.

parts.name: container
parts.docs: The container for the checkbox mark.

parts.name: mark
parts.docs: The checkmark used to indicate the checked state.
